content: the pumpkin granny square morethanyarn materials needed necessities acrylic or cotton yarn preferably weight 4 * you will need colors for the pumpkin the edges and the stem crochet hooks based on your yarn i recommend 3 5-4 mm scissors to trim yarn needle to weave ends * if using weight 4 with recommended hook the average granny square will be approx 4 in x 4 in recommended stitch markers for convenience steamer or frame for wet blocking note this pattern is best for experienced crocheters there is a free tutorial available on how to make a pumpkin my youtube channel if you need more than yarn - granny square| beginner help or would like to follow along friendly abbreviations terminology abbreviations stitch st slip_stitch slip_stitch single_crochet single_crochet half_double_crochet half_double_crochet double_crochet double_crochet standing double_crochet make a standing double_crochet in the previously marked 3rd slip_stitch at the bottom of your pumpkin to create a standing double_crochet hold the tail end of your yarn towards your body wrap your yarn around the hook twice coming from underneath the hook and towards your body continue holding the tail of your yarn to keep gauge move over to your work and insert your hook into the back loop of the slip_stitch pull up one stitch and treat this as a normal double_crochet if you need a visual aid watch my tutorial on youtube for reference how to make a pumpkin granny square time stamp 17 30 the pumpkin all crochet terminology is in us standard round one begin with a magic_ring and chain 3 make 10 double_crochet in the magic_ring tighten your magic_ring and slip_stitch into the top of your chain 3 round two chain 3 2 double_crochet in every stitch end the round with 20 stitches slip_stitch into
